label: 01 STAR Alignment and Deduplication_batch

inputs.label: Memory per job
inputs.description: Amount of RAM memory to be used per job. Defaults to 2048MB for single threaded jobs.

description:
Alignment to a reference genome and transcriptome presents the first step of RNA-Seq analysis. This pipeline uses STAR, an ultrafast RNA-seq aligner capable of mapping full length RNA sequences and detecting de novo canonical junctions, non-canonical splices, and chimeric (fusion) transcripts. It is optimized for mammalian sequence reads, but fine tuning of its parameters enables customization to satisfy unique needs.

STAR accepts one file per sample (or two files for paired-end data).  
Splice junction annotations can optionally be collected from splice junction databases. Set the "Overhang length" parameter to a value larger than zero in order to use splice junction databases. For constant read length, this value should (ideally) be equal to mate length decreased by 1; for long reads with non-constant length, this value should be 100 (pipeline default). 
FastQC Analysis on FASTQ files reveals read length distribution. STAR can detect chimeric transcripts, but parameter "Min segment length" in "Chimeric Alignments" category must be adjusted to a desired minimum chimeric segment length. Aligned reads are reported in BAM format and can be viewed in a genome browser (such as IGV). A file containing detected splice junctions is also produced.

Unmapped reads are reported in FASTQ format and can be included in an output BAM file. The "Output unmapped reads" and "Write unmapped in SAM" parameters enable unmapped output type selection.

run.label: SBG Flatten

outputs.label: All grouped files
outputs.description: All grouped files as one list.

inputs.label: Nested
inputs.description: Files from all SBG Group Input outputs should be provided.

run.description: SBG Flatten is used only with SBG Group Input app for purposes of providing grouped inputs. All SBG Group Input outputs should be passed to the "Nested" SBG Flatten input in order to produce the output with all grouped files as one list.

run.label: Picard MarkDuplicates

outputs.label: Metrics file
outputs.description: File to which the duplication metrics will be written.

outputs.label: Deduped BAM
outputs.description: The output file to which marked records will be written.

inputs.label: Verbosity
inputs.description: Control verbosity of logging. Default value: INFO. This option can be set to 'null' to clear the default value. Possible values: {ERROR, WARNING, INFO, DEBUG}.

inputs.label: Validation stringency
inputs.description: Validation stringency for all SAM files read by this program. Setting stringency to SILENT can improve performance when processing a BAM file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded. Default value: STRICT. This option can be set to 'null' to clear the default value. Possible values: {STRICT, LENIENT, SILENT}.

inputs.label: Sorting collections size ratio
inputs.description: This number, plus the maximum RAM available to the JVM, determine the memory footprint used by some of the sorting collections. If you are running out of memory, try reducing this number.

inputs.label: Remove duplicates
inputs.description: If this parameter is set to true, duplicates will be written to the output file. If set to false, duplicates will be written with the appropriate flags set. Default value: false. This option can be set to 'null' to clear the default value. Possible values: {true, false}.

inputs.label: Read name regex
inputs.description: Regular expression that can be used to parse read names in the incoming SAM file. Read names are parsed to extract three variables: tile/region, x coordinate and y coordinate. These values are used to estimate the rate of optical duplication in order to give a more accurate estimated library size. Set this option to null to disable optical duplicate detection. The regular expression should contain three capture groups for the three variables, in order. It must match the entire read name. Note that if the default regex is specified, a regex match is not actually done, but instead the read name is split on colon character. For 5 element names, the 3rd, 4th and 5th elements are assumed to be tile, x and y values, respectively. For 7 element names (CASAVA 1.8), the 5th, 6th, and 7th elements are assumed to be tile, x and y values, respectively. Default value: [a-zA-Z0-9]+:[0-9]:([0-9]+):([0-9]+):([0-9]+).*. This option can be set to 'null' to clear the default value.

inputs.label: Quiet
inputs.description: This parameter indicates whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err. Possible values: {True, False}.

inputs.label: Program record ID
inputs.description: The program record ID for the @PG record(s) created by this program. Set to null to disable PG record creation. This string may have a suffix appended to avoid collision with other program record IDs. Default value: MarkDuplicates. This option can be set to 'null' to clear the default value.

inputs.label: Program group version
inputs.description: Value of version number (VN) tag of program group (PG) record to be created. If not specified, the version will be detected automatically. Default value: null.

inputs.label: Program group name
inputs.description: Value of program name (PN) tag of program group (PG) record to be created. Default value: MarkDuplicates. This option can be set to 'null' to clear the default value.

inputs.label: Program group command line
inputs.description: Value of command line (CL) tag of program group (PG) record to be created. If not supplied the command line will be detected automatically. Default value: null.

inputs.label: Output format
inputs.description: Since Picard tools can output both SAM and BAM files, user can choose the format of the output file.

inputs.label: Optical duplicate pixel distance
inputs.description: The maximum offset between two duplicate clusters in order to consider them optical duplicates. This should usually be set to some fairly small number (e.g. 5-10 pixels) unless using later versions of the Illumina pipeline that multiply pixel values by 10, in which case 50-100 is more normal. Default value: 100. This option can be set to 'null' to clear the default value.

inputs.label: Memory per job
inputs.description: Amount of RAM memory to be used per job. Defaults to 2048MB for single threaded jobs.

inputs.label: Max sequences for disk read ends map
inputs.description: This option is obsolete. ReadEnds will always be spilled to disk. Default value: 50000. This option can be set to 'null' to clear the default value.

inputs.label: Max records in RAM
inputs.description: When writing SAM files that need to be sorted, this parameter will specify the number of records stored in RAM before spilling to disk. Increasing this number reduces the number of file handles needed to sort a SAM file, and increases the amount of RAM needed. Default value: 500000. This option can be set to 'null' to clear the default value.

inputs.label: Max file handles for read ends map
inputs.description: Maximum number of file handles to keep open when spilling read ends to disk. Set this number a little lower than the per-process maximum number of file that may be open. This number can be found by executing the 'ulimit -n' command on a Unix system. Default value: 8000. This option can be set to 'null' to clear the default value.

inputs.label: Input bam
inputs.description: This parameter indicates one or more input SAM or BAM files to analyze. Must be coordinate sorted.  Default value: null. This option may be specified 0 or more times.

inputs.label: Duplicate scoring strategy
inputs.description: This parameter indicates the scoring strategy for choosing the non-duplicate among candidates.

inputs.label: Create index
inputs.description: This parameter indicates whether to create a BAM index when writing a coordinate-sorted BAM file. Default value: False. This option can be set to 'null' to clear the default value. Possible values: {True, False}.

inputs.label: Compression level
inputs.description: Compression level for all compressed files created (e.g. BAM and GELI). Default value: 5. This option can be set to 'null' to clear the default value.

inputs.label: Comment
inputs.description: Comment(s) to include in the output file's header. Default value: null. This option may be specified 0 or more times.

inputs.label: Assume sorted
inputs.description: If this parameter is set to true, it is assumed that the input file is coordinate sorted even if the header says otherwise.  Default value: false. This option can be set to 'null' to clear the default value. Possible values: {true, false}.

run.description: Picard MarkDuplicates examines aligned records in the supplied SAM or BAM file to locate duplicate molecules. All records are then written to the output file with the duplicate records flagged.

run.label: SBG Pair FASTQs by Metadata

inputs.label: List of FASTQ files
inputs.description: List of the FASTQ files with properly set metadata fileds.

run.description: Tool accepts list of FASTQ files for one sample as the input and groups them into pairs  (two files for each paired end). This grouping is done using metadata values that are creating unique combination for each pair or of FASTQ files. Metadata that fields that are uniquely defining one FASTQ pair are Sample ID, Library ID, Platform unit ID and File segment number. Listed order of metadata fields is also representing their hierarchy in the metadata structure. Not all of these four metadata fields are required, but the present set has to be sufficient to create unique combinations for each pair of FASTQ files.

run.label: Eautils Fastq-mcf

stdout.script:
{
  reads = [].concat($job.inputs.reads)
  file_path = reads[0].path
  filename = file_path.split('/').slice(-1)[0]
  filebase = filename.split('.').slice(0, 1).join('.')
  out_name = filebase.concat(".fastqmcf_summary.txt")
  return out_name
  
  
}

outputs.label: Summary
outputs.description: A text file containing summary of the filtration.

outputs.label: Skipped reads
outputs.description: FASTQ files containing reads that were filtered out from the input.

outputs.label: Filtered reads
outputs.description: FASTQ files processed according to the set parameters.

inputs.label: Trimming window size
inputs.description: Window-size for quality trimming.

inputs.label: SKew percentage
inputs.description: SKew percentage-less-than causing cycle removal.

inputs.label: Set all default parameters to zero/do nothing
inputs.description: Set all default parameters to zero/do nothing.

inputs.label: Save discarded reads
inputs.description: Save all discarded reads to '.skip' files.

inputs.label: Remove homopolymer reads
inputs.description: Remove >95% homopolymer read.

inputs.label: Remove duplicate reads
inputs.description: Remove duplicate reads : Read_1 has an identical N bases.

inputs.label: Reads
inputs.description: A single FASTQ file for single end or two files for paired end experiments.

inputs.label: Quality threshold
inputs.description: Quality threshold causing base removal.

inputs.label: Minimum mean quality score
inputs.description: Minimum mean quality score.

inputs.label: Quality greater than threshold
inputs.description: At least NUM quals > THR.

inputs.label: Phred adjust max
inputs.description: Adjust scores > SCORE to SCOTE.

inputs.label: Adjust score
inputs.description: Adjust score SCORE by amount AMT.

inputs.label: Phred-scale
inputs.description: Phred-scale.

inputs.label: Output N records
inputs.description: Only output the first N records.

inputs.label: Output lots of random debugging stuff
inputs.description: Output lots of random debugging stuff.

inputs.label: Number of reads to use for subsampling
inputs.description: Number of reads to use for subsampling.

inputs.label: Minimum remaining sequence length
inputs.description: Minimum remaining sequence length.

inputs.label: Minimum length match
inputs.description: Log scale for adapter minimum-length-match.

inputs.label: Minimum remaining length
inputs.description: Minimum remaining length (same as -l).

inputs.label: Min clip length
inputs.description: Minimum clip length, overrides scaled auto.

inputs.label: Maximum remaining sequence length
inputs.description: Maximum remaining sequence length.

inputs.label: Max adapter difference
inputs.description: Maximum adapter difference percentage.

inputs.label: Max output reads
inputs.description: Only output first N records (same as -O).

inputs.label: Maxmium N-calls
inputs.description: Maxmium N-calls in a read (can be a %).

inputs.label: Mate quality minimum score
inputs.description: Minimum mean quality score, applies to second non-barcode read only.

inputs.label: Quality greater than threshold, applies to second non-barcode read only
inputs.description: At least NUM quals > THR.

inputs.label: Mate minimum remaining length
inputs.description: Minimum remaining length (same as -l).

inputs.label: Mate maxmium N-calls in a read
inputs.description: Maximum N-calls in a read (can be a %), applies to second non-barcode read only.

inputs.label: Complexity filter
inputs.description: Complexity filter percent.

inputs.label: Keep only clipped reads
inputs.description: Only keep clipped reads.

inputs.label: Keep clipped
inputs.description: Only keep clipped (same as -K).

inputs.label: Illumina PF
inputs.description: Force disable/enable Illumina PF filtering.

inputs.label: Homopolymer filter percentage
inputs.description: Homopolymer filter percentage, evaluated after clipping/trimming.

inputs.label: Dont remove Ns
inputs.description: Don't remove N's from the fronts/ends of reads.

inputs.label: Don't clip
inputs.description: Dont clip, just output what would be done.

inputs.label: Adjust cycle
inputs.description: Adjust cycle CYC (negative = offset from end) by amount AMT.

inputs.label: Bad read percentage threshold
inputs.description: 'N' (Bad read) percentage causing cycle removal.

inputs.label: Adapters
inputs.description: A list of adapters to clip in FASTA format.

inputs.label: Adapter occurrence threshold
inputs.description: % occurance threshold before adapter clipping.

run.description: Detects levels of adapter presence, computes likelihoods and locations (start, end) of the adapters. Removes the adapter sequences from the FASTQ file(s).

run.label: SBG Flatten

outputs.label: All grouped files
outputs.description: All grouped files as one list.

inputs.label: Nested
inputs.description: Files from all SBG Group Input outputs should be provided.

run.description: SBG Flatten is used only with SBG Group Input app for purposes of providing grouped inputs. All SBG Group Input outputs should be passed to the "Nested" SBG Flatten input in order to produce the output with all grouped files as one list.

run.label: STAR

outputs.label: Reads per gene
outputs.description: File with number of reads per gene. A read is counted if it overlaps (1nt or more) one and only one gene.

outputs.label: Splice junctions
outputs.description: High confidence collapsed splice junctions in tab-delimited format. Only junctions supported by uniquely mapping reads are reported.

outputs.label: Chimeric junctions
outputs.description: If chimSegmentMin in 'Chimeric Alignments' section is set to 0, 'Chimeric Junctions' won't be output.

outputs.label: Intermediate genome files
outputs.description: Archive with genome files produced when annotations are included on the fly (in the mapping step).

outputs.label: Chimeric alignments
outputs.description: Aligned Chimeric sequences SAM - if chimSegmentMin = 0, no Chimeric Alignment SAM and Chimeric Junctions outputs.

inputs.label: Read sequence
inputs.sbg:fileTypes: FASTA, FASTQ, FA, FQ, FASTQ.GZ, FQ.GZ, FASTQ.BZ2, FQ.BZ2
inputs.description: Read sequence. In case of paired-end alignment it is crucial to set metadata 'paired-end' field to 1/2.

inputs.label: Reads lengths
inputs.description: Equal/Not equal - lengths of names, sequences, qualities for both mates are the same/not the same. "Not equal" is safe in all situations.

inputs.label: Reads to map
inputs.description: Number of reads to map from the beginning of the file.

inputs.label: Junctions max number
inputs.description: Max number of junctions for one read (including all multi-mappers).

inputs.label: Collapsed junctions max number
inputs.description: Max number of collapsed junctions.

inputs.label: Output unmapped reads
inputs.description: Output of unmapped reads (besides SAM). None: no output; Fastx: output in separate fasta/fastq files, Unmapped.out.mate1/2.

inputs.label: Quality conversion
inputs.description: Add this number to the quality score (e.g. to convert from Illumina to Sanger, use -31).

inputs.label: Output format
inputs.description: Format of output alignments.

inputs.label: Output sorting type
inputs.description: Type of output sorting.

inputs.label: SAM mode
inputs.description: Mode of SAM output. Full: full SAM output; NoQS: full SAM but without quality scores.

inputs.label: Strand field flag
inputs.description: Cufflinks-like strand field flag. None: not used; intronMotif: strand derived from the intron motif. Reads with inconsistent and/or non-canonical introns are filtered out.

inputs.label: SAM attributes
inputs.description: Desired SAM attributes, in the order desired for the output SAM. NH: any combination in any order; Standard: NH HI AS nM; All: NH HI AS nM NM MD jM jI; None: no attributes.

inputs.label: Write unmapped in SAM
inputs.description: Output of unmapped reads in the SAM format. None: no output Within: output unmapped reads within the main SAM file (i.e. Aligned.out.sam).

inputs.label: Sorting in SAM
inputs.description: Type of sorting for the SAM output. Paired: one mate after the other for all paired alignments; PairedKeepInputOrder: one mate after the other for all paired alignments, the order is kept the same as in the input FASTQ files.

inputs.label: Primary alignments
inputs.description: Which alignments are considered primary - all others will be marked with 0x100 bit in the FLAG. OneBestScore: only one alignment with the best score is primary; AllBestScore: all alignments with the best score are primary.

inputs.label: Read ID
inputs.description: Read ID record type. Standard: first word (until space) from the FASTx read ID line, removing /1,/2 from the end; Number: read number (index) in the FASTx file.

inputs.label: MAPQ value
inputs.description: MAPQ value for unique mappers (0 to 255).

inputs.label: OR SAM flag
inputs.description: Set specific bits of the SAM FLAG.

inputs.label: AND SAM flag
inputs.description: Set specific bits of the SAM FLAG.

inputs.label: SAM header @HD
inputs.description: @HD (header) line of the SAM header.

inputs.label: SAM header @PG
inputs.description: Extra @PG (software) line of the SAM header (in addition to STAR).

inputs.label: Sequencing center
inputs.description: Specify the sequencing center for RG line.

inputs.label: Library ID
inputs.description: Specify the library ID for RG line.

inputs.label: Median fragment length
inputs.description: Specify the median fragment length for RG line.

inputs.label: Platform
inputs.description: Specify the version of the technology that was used for sequencing or assaying.

inputs.label: Platform unit ID
inputs.description: Specify the platform unit ID for RG line.

inputs.label: Sample ID
inputs.description: Specify the sample ID for RG line.

inputs.label: Filtering type
inputs.description: Type of filtering. Normal: standard filtering using only current alignment; BySJout: keep only those reads that contain junctions that passed filtering into SJ.out.tab.

inputs.label: Multimapping score range
inputs.description: The score range below the maximum score for multimapping alignments.

inputs.label: Max number of mappings
inputs.description: Read alignments will be output only if the read maps fewer than this value, otherwise no alignments will be output.

inputs.label: Max number of mismatches
inputs.description: Alignment will be output only if it has fewer mismatches than this value.

inputs.label: Mismatches to *mapped* length
inputs.description: Alignment will be output only if its ratio of mismatches to *mapped* length is less than this value.

inputs.label: Mismatches to *read* length
inputs.description: Alignment will be output only if its ratio of mismatches to *read* length is less than this value.

inputs.label: Min score
inputs.description: Alignment will be output only if its score is higher than this value.

inputs.label: Min score normalized
inputs.description: 'Minimum score' normalized to read length (sum of mates' lengths for paired-end reads).

inputs.label: Min matched bases
inputs.description: Alignment will be output only if the number of matched bases is higher than this value.

inputs.label: Min matched bases normalized
inputs.description: 'Minimum matched bases' normalized to read length (sum of mates lengths for paired-end reads).

inputs.label: Motifs filtering
inputs.description: Filter alignment using their motifs. None: no filtering; RemoveNoncanonical: filter out alignments that contain non-canonical junctions; RemoveNoncanonicalUnannotated: filter out alignments that contain non-canonical unannotated junctions when using annotated splice junctions database. The annotated non-canonical junctions will be kept.

inputs.label: Collapsed junctions reads
inputs.description: Which reads to consider for collapsed splice junctions output. All: all reads, unique- and multi-mappers; Unique: uniquely mapping reads only.

inputs.label: Min overhang SJ
inputs.description: Minimum overhang length for splice junctions on both sides for each of the motifs. To set no output for desired motif, assign -1 to the corresponding field. Does not apply to annotated junctions.

inputs.label: Min unique count
inputs.description: Minimum uniquely mapping read count per junction for each of the motifs. To set no output for desired motif, assign -1 to the corresponding field. Junctions are output if one of --outSJfilterCountUniqueMin OR --outSJfilterCountTotalMin conditions are satisfied. Does not apply to annotated junctions.

inputs.label: Min total count
inputs.description: Minimum total (multi-mapping+unique) read count per junction for each of the motifs. To set no output for desired motif, assign -1 to the corresponding field. Junctions are output if one of --outSJfilterCountUniqueMin OR --outSJfilterCountTotalMin conditions are satisfied. Does not apply to annotated junctions.

inputs.label: Min distance to other donor/acceptor
inputs.description: Minimum allowed distance to other junctions' donor/acceptor for each of the motifs (int >= 0). Does not apply to annotated junctions.

inputs.label: Max gap allowed
inputs.description: Maximum gap allowed for junctions supported by 1,2,3...N reads (int >= 0) i.e. by default junctions supported by 1 read can have gaps <=50000b, by 2 reads: <=100000b, by 3 reads: <=200000. By 4 or more reads: any gap <=alignIntronMax. Does not apply to annotated junctions.

inputs.label: Gap open penalty
inputs.description: Gap open penalty.

inputs.label: Non-canonical gap open
inputs.description: Non-canonical gap open penalty (in addition to --scoreGap).

inputs.label: GC/AG and CT/GC gap open
inputs.description: GC/AG and CT/GC gap open penalty (in addition to --scoreGap).

inputs.label: AT/AC and GT/AT gap open
inputs.description: AT/AC and GT/AT gap open penalty (in addition to --scoreGap).

inputs.label: Log scaled score
inputs.description: Extra score logarithmically scaled with genomic length of the alignment: <int>*log2(genomicLength).

inputs.label: Deletion open penalty
inputs.description: Deletion open penalty.

inputs.label: Deletion extension penalty
inputs.description: Deletion extension penalty per base (in addition to --scoreDelOpen).

inputs.label: Insertion Open Penalty
inputs.description: Insertion open penalty.

inputs.label: Insertion extension penalty
inputs.description: Insertion extension penalty per base (in addition to --scoreInsOpen).

inputs.label: Max score reduction
inputs.description: Maximum score reduction while searching for SJ boundaries in the stitching step.

inputs.label: Search start point
inputs.description: Defines the search start point through the read - the read is split into pieces no longer than this value (int>0).

inputs.label: Search start point normalized
inputs.description: SeedSearchStartLmax normalized to read length (sum of mates' lengths for paired-end reads).

inputs.label: Max seed length
inputs.description: Defines the maximum length of the seeds, if =0 max seed length is infinite (int>=0).

inputs.label: Filter pieces for stitching
inputs.description: Only pieces that map fewer than this value are utilized in the stitching procedure (int>=0).

inputs.label: Max seeds per read
inputs.description: Max number of seeds per read (int>=0).

inputs.label: Max seeds per window
inputs.description: Max number of seeds per window (int>=0).

inputs.label: Max one-seed loci per window
inputs.description: Max number of one seed loci per window (int>=0).

inputs.label: Min intron size
inputs.description: Minimum intron size: genomic gap is considered intron if its length >= alignIntronMin, otherwise it is considered Deletion (int>=0).

inputs.label: Max intron size
inputs.description: Maximum intron size, if 0, max intron size will be determined by (2^winBinNbits)*winAnchorDistNbins.

inputs.label: Max mates gap
inputs.description: Maximum gap between two mates, if 0, max intron gap will be determined by (2^winBinNbits)*winAnchorDistNbins.

inputs.label: Min overhang
inputs.description: Minimum overhang (i.e. block size) for spliced alignments (int>0).

inputs.label: Min overhang: annotated
inputs.description: Minimum overhang (i.e. block size) for annotated (sjdb) spliced alignments (int>0).

inputs.label: Min mapped length
inputs.description: Minimum mapped length for a read mate that is spliced (int>0).

inputs.label: Min mapped length normalized
inputs.description: AlignSplicedMateMapLmin normalized to mate length (float>0).

inputs.label: Max windows per read
inputs.description: Max number of windows per read (int>0).

inputs.label: Max transcripts per window
inputs.description: Max number of transcripts per window (int>0).

inputs.label: Max transcripts per read
inputs.description: Max number of different alignments per read to consider (int>0).

inputs.label: Alignment type
inputs.description: Type of read ends alignment. Local: standard local alignment with soft-clipping allowed. EndToEnd: force end to end read alignment, do not soft-clip.

inputs.label: Soft clipping
inputs.description: Option which allows soft clipping of alignments at the reference (chromosome) ends. Can be disabled for compatibility with Cufflinks/Cuffmerge. Yes: Enables soft clipping; No: Disables soft clipping.

inputs.label: Max loci anchors
inputs.description: Max number of loci anchors are allowed to map to (int>0).

inputs.label: Bin size
inputs.description: =log2(winBin), where winBin is the size of the bin for the windows/clustering, each window will occupy an integer number of bins (int>0).

inputs.label: Max bins between anchors
inputs.description: Max number of bins between two anchors that allows aggregation of anchors into one window (int>0).

inputs.label: Flanking regions size
inputs.description: =log2(winFlank), where win Flank is the size of the left and right flanking regions for each window (int>0).

inputs.label: Min segment length
inputs.description: Minimum length of chimeric segment length, if =0, no chimeric output (int>=0).

inputs.label: Min total score
inputs.description: Minimum total (summed) score of the chimeric segments (int>=0).

inputs.label: Max drop score
inputs.description: Max drop (difference) of chimeric score (the sum of scores of all chimeric segements) from the read length (int>=0).

inputs.label: Min separation score
inputs.description: Minimum difference (separation) between the best chimeric score and the next one (int>=0).

inputs.label: Non-GT/AG penalty
inputs.description: Penalty for a non-GT/AG chimeric junction.

inputs.label: Min junction overhang
inputs.description: Minimum overhang for a chimeric junction (int>=0).

inputs.label: Quantification mode
inputs.description: Types of quantification requested. 'TranscriptomeSAM' option outputs SAM/BAM alignments to transcriptome into a separate file. With 'GeneCounts' option, STAR will count number of reads per gene while mapping.

inputs.label: Reads to process in 1st step
inputs.description: Number of reads to process for the 1st step. 0: 1-step only, no 2nd pass; use very large number to map all reads in the first step (int>0).

inputs.label: Two-pass mode
inputs.description: 2-pass mapping mode. None: 1-pass mapping; Basic: basic 2-pass mapping, with all 1st pass junctions inserted into the genome indices on the fly.

inputs.label: Genome dir name

valueFrom.script: $job.inputs.genomeDirName || "genomeDir"

inputs.description: Name of the directory which contains genome files (when genome.tar is uncompressed).

inputs.label: Save junction files
inputs.description: Which files to save when sjdb junctions are inserted on the fly at the mapping step. None: not saving files at all; Basic: only small junction/transcript files; All: all files including big Genome, SA and SAindex. These files are output as archive.

inputs.label: Chromosome names
inputs.description: Prefix for chromosome names in a GTF file (e.g. 'chr' for using ENSMEBL annotations with UCSC geneomes).

inputs.label: Set exons feature
inputs.description: Feature type in GTF file to be used as exons for building transcripts.

inputs.label: Exons' parents name
inputs.description: Tag name to be used as exons’ transcript-parents.

inputs.label: Gene name
inputs.description: Tag name to be used as exons’ gene-parents.

inputs.label: "Overhang" length
inputs.description: Length of the donor/acceptor sequence on each side of the junctions, ideally = (mate_length - 1) (int >= 0), if int = 0, splice junction database is not used.

inputs.label: Extra alignment score
inputs.description: Extra alignment score for alignments that cross database junctions.

inputs.label: Splice junction file
inputs.description: Gene model annotations and/or known transcripts. No need to include this input, except in case of using "on the fly" annotations.

inputs.label: Clip 3p bases
inputs.description: Number of bases to clip from 3p of each mate. In case only one value is given, it will be assumed the same for both mates.

inputs.label: Clip 5p bases
inputs.description: Number of bases to clip from 5p of each mate. In case only one value is given, it will be assumed the same for both mates.

inputs.label: Clip 3p adapter sequence
inputs.description: Adapter sequence to clip from 3p of each mate. In case only one value is given, it will be assumed the same for both mates.

inputs.label: Max mismatches proportions
inputs.description: Max proportion of mismatches for 3p adapter clipping for each mate. In case only one value is given, it will be assumed the same for both mates.

inputs.label: Clip 3p after adapter seq
inputs.description: Number of bases to clip from 3p of each mate after the adapter clipping. In case only one value is given, it will be assumed the same for both mates.

inputs.label: Chimeric output type
inputs.description: Type of chimeric output. SeparateSAMold: output old SAM into separate Chimeric.out.sam file; Within: output into main aligned SAM/BAM files.

inputs.label: Genome files
inputs.description: Genome files created using STAR Genome Generate.

inputs.label: Max insert junctions
inputs.description: Maximum number of junction to be inserted to the genome on the fly at the mapping stage, including those from annotations and those detected in the 1st step of the 2-pass run.

inputs.label: Prohibit alignment type
inputs.description: Prohibit various alignment type. IndelSoftclipSingleend: prohibit indels, soft clipping and single-end alignments - compatible with RSEM; Singleend: prohibit single-end alignments.

inputs.label: Limit BAM sorting memory
inputs.description: Maximum available RAM for sorting BAM. If set to 0, it will be set to the genome index size.

run.description:
STAR is an ultrafast universal RNA-seq aligner. It has very high mapping speed, accurate alignment of contiguous and spliced reads, detection of polyA-tails, non-canonical splices and chimeric (fusion) junctions. It works with reads starting from lengths ~15 bases up to ~300 bases. In case of having longer reads, use of STAR Long is recommended.

###Common issues###
1. In case of paired-end alignment it is crucial to set metadata 'paired-end' field to 1/2.
2. Files in multi-FASTQ format are currently not supported, i.e. if you have single-end reads that span multiple FASTQ files, or paired-end reads that span more than 2 files, please use a tool like SBG Merge FASTQs before providing your files to the STAR aligner.
run.sbg:revisionNotes: Update some expressions to accpet multiple fastq files.

sbg:revisionsInfo.sbg:revisionNotes: Add proper 'Reference Genome' metadata to BAM/SAM outputs.
Changed number of cores from 15 to 32.
Multiple read pairs can be included in the command line now. In order to have the same order of the pairs, "Sample ID" metadata has to be set. Otherwise, pairs will be ordered randomly.
Update some expressions to accpet multiple fastq files.

run.sbg:cmdPreview: tar -xvf genome.ext && /opt/STAR --runThreadN 32    --sjdbGTFfile /demo/test-data/chr20.gtf  --sjdbGTFchrPrefix chrPrefix --sjdbInsertSave Basic  --twopass1readsN -1  --chimOutType WithinBAM  --outSAMattrRGline ID:a CN:illumina PI:rg_mfl PL:Ion_Torrent_PGM PU:rg_platform_unit SM:rg_sample , ID:b PI:rg_mfl PL:Ion_Torrent_PGM PU:rg_platform_unit SM:rg_sample  --quantMode TranscriptomeSAM --outFileNamePrefix ./read.  --readFilesIn /test-data/read_A_1.fastq,/test-data/read_B_1.fastq /test-data/read_A_2.fastq,/test-data/read_B_2.fastq  && tar -vcf read._STARgenome.tar ./read._STARgenome  && mv read.Unmapped.out.mate1 read.Unmapped.out.mate1.fastq && mv read.Unmapped.out.mate2 read.Unmapped.out.mate2.fastq
